page.title: 15LOCAL FETES IN CHESHIRE.
page.content: Most villages in Cheshire hold annual Fetes and Carnivals, usually in May or June. I will describe the Comberbach Village Fete which is a very typical example. The main event is the crowning of the Rose Queen (or Carnival Queen), attended by her Attendants, Page boys, and Flower girls. Entertainment is provided for children, parents and Senior Citizens. There are Donkey rides, Bran Tubs, and all the usual stalls. Local clubs, organizations and playgroups prepare floats which are driven in procession and then judged. Each year has a different theme. This year's theme for Comberbach was the Circus. Of course, organizing a Fete takes a great deal of time and work and each village has a committee which begins its plans early in the year. The same committee often organizes Bonfire Nights.
